intro: Phlegmariurus gracilis, commonly known as the slender clubmoss, is a vascular plant belonging to the family Lycopodiaceae. It is a small, evergreen shrub that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. The plant has needle-like leaves that are arranged in whorls around the stems, and it produces spore-bearing cones called strobili. Phlegmariurus gracilis is characterized by its simple, branching structure and its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils. This plant plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small organisms in its native ecosystems.
